revised_title: Moorish Cuisine and Culinary Practices in West Barbary
tldr: The author provides a detailed account of the Moorish way of dressing their meat and other culinary practices in West Barbary, from Cape Spartel to Cape de Geer. The text describes various traditional dishes, breakfast customs, and the hospitality and respect shown to guests in the region.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Cultural Anthropology
